content: Millions of people across the northeastern states are advised to limit their time outdoors and to wear N95 masks due to poor air quality caused by intense wildfire smoke drifting down from Canada.
CNN fires CEO Chris Licht after a 15,000 word profile disgracing Licht was published in The Atlantic.
North Dakota governor Doug Burgum announces his candidacy for President.
Former Vice President Mike Pence announces his candidacy for President.
A shooting takes place at the Altria Theater in Richmond, Virginia after a graduation ceremony, killing two.
Former New Jersey governor Chris Christie announces his candidacy for President.

Apple unveils a mixed-reality headset called the Vision Pro, its first new product category since the Apple Watch in 2015. The device is noted for its expected retail price of $3,499 that is considerably higher than other VR and AR headsets on the market.
The state of Oklahoma approves the first ever religious charter school in the United States.
President Biden signs the Fiscal Responsibility Act of 2023 into law in an effort to prevent the United States from entering a debt ceiling default.
Fort Bragg, originally named for Confederate General Braxton Bragg, is renamed Fort Liberty.
